description.narrative: Mainstream biodiversity conservation priorities into Moldova’s territorial planning policies and land-use practices.

activity-description.narrative: Protect Implementation Unit / Mitropolit Dosoftei 156A , of 306

Soroca District ( Zastinca and Badiceni villages ) District Spatial Plans (DSP) (under responsibility of MRDC) for Soroca district Land Use Plans (LUP) (under responsibility of LPAs, CPAs, District Councils) forZastinca and Badiceni villages Developing Forest Management Plans (FMPs) for Zastinca a

Stefan-Voda District ( Talmaza and Copceac villages ) District Spatial Plans (DSP) (under responsibility of MRDC) for Stefan-Voda district Land Use Plans (LUP) (under responsibility of LPAs, CPAs, District Councils) for ( Talmaza and Copceac villages ) Developing Forest Management Plans (FMPs) for

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1. Land area (ha) for which DSPs and LUPs, that deliver biodiversity benefits outside PAs are developed. 2. Number of sectoral amendments to regulations and guidelines proposed facilitating the incorporation of biodiversity conservation requirements into planning and management of land use outside protected areas. 3. Recorded cases of illegal logging in Soroca and Stefan Voda districts. 4. % of grazing norms observed by local land users in all pilot sites. 5. Number of government staff trained in collection of biodiversity information and integration of this into the development and implementation of land use plans 6. Ha of land outside protected areas where threats to biodiversity from economic activities are controlled. 7. Population of indicator species outside PAs improves at pilot sites. 8. % of local land-users in 2 districts who are conducting economic activities in ecologically sensitive areas and receive in-field training and technical assistance with implementing modified practices. 9. Expenditures in public finance for biodiversity mainstreaming in land use planning in pilot areas.

comment.narrative: 1. 0 ha 2. 0 regulations and guidelines 3. Soroca-17 cases and Stefan-Voda-17 cases 4. 0% of land users observing norms 5. 0 staff 6. 0 ha 7. % of total plant composition in case of fauna; number of colonies and individual in case of flora 8. 0% 9. None

1. DSPs for 204136.98 ha from Soroca and Stefan Voda districts approved by district councils. 2. Inputs related to BD mainstreaming to the SEA guidelines and Moldova 2030 strategy provided. The final version of the Forestry Code passed official consultation process 3.Biodiversity-related passports and mandatory conservation actions provided to district-level environmental inspections and the LPA’s for further monitoring of illegal logging in Soroca and Stefan Voda districts. Impact evaluation of implementation of FMPs and PMPs performed. 4. Grazing norms developed and approved by targeted local public authorities 5. At least 10 governmental officers (preferable from newly established Ecological Agency) trained in collection of biodiversity information and integration of this into the development and implementation of land use plans. 6. Restoration activities on 100 ha of degraded pastures and 100 ha of community forests ongoing; Sustainable management planning activities on 2484 ha of pastures and 800,7 ha of community forests on going; 7. Indicator species assessment completed prior to the Terminal Evaluation. 8. Training modules for biodiversity sensitive spatial and land use planning institutionalized at the Academy for Public Administration 9. Solutions provided to promote increasing the expenditures for biodiversity mainstreaming in land use planning in pilot areas.

1. DSPs for 204136.98 ha from Soroca and Stefan Voda districts passed official consultation process and were approved by district councils in April and September 2018. 2. Inputs related to BD mainstreaming to the SEA guidelines and Moldova 2030 strategy provided. The final version of the Forestry Code passed official consultation process and awaiting government approval. 3.Biodiversity-related passports and mandatory conservation actions provided to district-level environmental inspections and the LPA’s for further monitoring of illegal logging in Soroca and Stefan Voda districts. Impact evaluation of implementation of FMPs and PMPs under implementation by the end of 2018, and will end up with a Guidelines for FMP and PMP impact evaluation. A handbook for rare species habitats from Soroca and Stefan Voda districts developed and distributed at central and local levels. 4. Grazing norms developed for each of the communities and are being approved at the community council meetings. 5. At least 15 governmental officers will be trained by the end of 2018 in collection of biodiversity information and integration of this into the development and implementation of land use plans. 6. Restoration activities on 100 ha of degraded pastures and 100 ha of community forests finalized. Additional 52 ha of degraded lands were afforested by NGO community with direct support from the project. 7. Indicator species assessment completed prior to the Terminal Evaluation showing increase in species population in the result of performed activities. 8. Training modules for biodiversity sensitive spatial and land use planning were endorsed to the Academy for Public Administration and will be included in the next years curricula. 9. According to the project assessment, the district level budgets do not receive sufficient financial resources for environment related initiatives, financing relaying on local taxes for natural resources use (which are very small as well). To reach the target (in a long term) a decision was taken to support the capacities of district level authorities to promote big scale projects, argued by a complex full-fledged cost -benefit analysis and supported by the developed DSP. Also, the assessment of the economic valuation potential of the ecosystems in the two pilot districts have provided the necessary groundwork that will contribute to future income generation, necessary for the implementation of the land use plans in the pilot areas.
